page.title: 01Introducing Block 04240480
page.content: This area of North Yorkshire, in Hambleton Rural District is attractive and well wooded country with two villages and several outlying farms. The farming is mixed arable and grassland.Both villages have histories from pagan times,but Nosterfield is small with a church,public house and no shop.Well has a church,Methodist chapel,shop/post office(that closes on Thurs.& Sat. afts and all Sun.),an old school,public house and a little used institute.There is electricity(no gas) telephone,mains water and sewage. Well is 8kms from the A1 and 8kms from open moor.The land to the east is flat but rises steeply in the village giving views over the Vale of York to the Hambleton Hills.The western ridge (146m at the trig.pillar) is the enclosed Watlass moor with views over Mashamshire and into Wensleydale.
